abstract.p: Bill Moyers will host four-part public television series, On Our Own Terms: Moyers on Dying; discussion groups are planned in Westchester County, NY; photo (By the Way column) (S)

block.p: First, Bill Moyers did beginnings, in the television series ''Genesis: A Living Conversation.''
Now he is turning his attention to endings with ''On Our Own Terms: Moyers on Dying,'' a four-part look at options for dying with comfort and dignity.
First, Bill Moyers did beginnings, in the television series ''Genesis: A Living Conversation.''
Now he is turning his attention to endings with ''On Our Own Terms: Moyers on Dying,'' a four-part look at options for dying with comfort and dignity.

Bringing the subject closer to home, Channel Thirteen/WNET has developed programs especially for the tri-state area exploring choices in end-of-life care. The Moyers series will be broadcast from today through Wednesday at 9 p.m.; the Channel Thirteen programs will follow immediately afterward at 10:30 p.m.

And still closer to home are related discussions organized by Westchester groups. In Briarcliff Manor, one program, ''Circle of Life: A Story Circle for Sharing End-of-Life Experiences,'' will take place tonight from 6 to 8 at Congregation Sons of Israel, a co-host along with Brandywine Nursing Home and Briarcliff Congregational Church. (Information: 914-762-2700 or 914-762-2804.) Hospice of Westchester is sponsoring another discussion on Sept. 20 and 27, and Oct. 4 and 11, at Memorial United Methodist Church in White Plains. (Information: 914-949-2146.)
